definition: Jeju Island special autonomous province, South Korea, a World Heritage site
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji
prefecture/(old) province/(old) administrative division/state (e.g. of US)/oblast (Russia)/canton (Switzerland)
variant of 島|岛[dao3]
island/CL:個|个[ge4],座[zuo4]

sentences.english: The meeting is to be held on Jeju Island of the ROK from May 29 to 30.
sentences.chinese: 此次会议将于5月29日至30日在韩国济州岛举行。

sentences.english: Female divers of the Jeju Islands. Image by Brenda Paik Suno.
sentences.chinese: 济州岛的女性捞海者，图由白苏诺摄。

sentences.english: Thus, half of Jeju-do island is taken up by hunting grounds.
sentences.chinese: 因此，直到今天，济州岛近一半面积仍是狩猎场。

sentences.english: The government says the test grid in Jeju is the largest such project in the world.
sentences.chinese: 政府说在济州岛试验电网是世界此类最大的项目。
